title: Wilderness Agility Course

properties.value: The Wilderness Agility Course is an Agility training area located in the Wilderness, available to players with level 52 Agility.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Wilderness Agility CourseThe RuneScape Classic Wiki also has an article on: classicrsw:Wilderness Agility Course
Wilderness Agility Course
Released28 January 2003 (Update)
MembersYes
LocationWilderness
Wilderness level50-56
Map
Advanced data
Typeagility course

The Wilderness Agility Course is an Agility training area located in the Wilderness, available to players with level 52 Agility.

The Agility course rewards 571.4 Agility experience per completed lap. With an average time of 40 seconds per lap, it is possible to get upwards of 47,500 Agility experience per hour from this course. At lower Agility levels expect to get around 40,000 Agility experience per hour, depending on concentration levels.

Contents

  • 1 Introduction
  • 2 Getting there
  • 3 Strategies
    • 3.1 Clothing
    • 3.2 Inventory
  • 4 The course
  • 5 Experience rates
  • 6 Trivia

Introduction[edit | edit source]

The Wilderness Agility Course requires level 52 Agility to access. However, this level is only needed to access the course through the gates; the minimum level requirement of the obstacles is level 49. Therefore it is a popular method to access this course by using a temporary skill boost to access the course starting at level 47, since the experience per hour at this course is far superior to other courses available to these players. The Agility course consists of five obstacles that players can pass in return for Agility experience. If all obstacles are passed in the correct order, some bonus experience is rewarded at the end of the lap. Some of the obstacles can be failed by the player, resulting in damage. Failed obstacles have to be tried again before going for the next obstacle, in order to become eligible for the bonus experience at the end of the lap. Players with higher Agility have a higher success rate at passing the obstacles, however even at level 99 it is still possible to fail an obstacle.

Since this Agility course is located deep in the Wilderness, ranging from level 50 to 56, it is possible to come across player killers while training there. Additionally, there are two level 25 skeletons roaming the Agility course that will attack any player near them.

Getting there[edit | edit source]

There are several different methods for travelling to the Wilderness Agility Course. The best options, in order of fastest to slowest, are:

  • Teleport to the Frozen Waste Plateau by casting the Ice Plateau Teleport spell. This spell is on the Lunar spellbook and requires level 89 Magic and completion of Lunar Diplomacy to cast. Run east from here.
  • Teleport to the Frozen Waste Plateau by casting the Ghorrock Teleport spell. This spell is on the Ancient spellbook and requires level 96 Magic and completion of Desert Treasure to cast. Run north-west from here, go through the gates and then run south-east.
    • Alternatively, use the Ghorrock teleport to bypass the Magic level requirement.
  • Teleport to the Wilderness obelisk in level 44 Wilderness. Run north-west from here, go through the gates and then run east.
  • Teleport to the Lava Maze using a burning amulet. Run north-west from here, go through the gates and then run east.
  • Teleport using the Edgeville teleport lever to teleport to the Deserted Keep. From here, run north and cut the web. Then run west. Bring a knife or any slash weapon to cut the net.

Strategies[edit | edit source]

Clothing[edit | edit source]

  • Wear weight-reducing clothing to achieve a weight of 0 kg or lower. This results in a lower run energy depletion rate.
    • Note that this course is located in the Wilderness, don't take items you are not prepared to lose.
  • Optionally, bring armour and weaponry to combat any player killers.

Inventory[edit | edit source]

  • Bring some food to restore lost Hitpoints from taking damage from failing Agility obstacles.
  • Bring enough Energy-restoring items for enough energy to constantly run around the course.
  • Optionally, bring runes or tablets to cast Bones to Peaches, as there are bones spawns in the Wilderness Agility Course Dungeon beneath the Agility course.

The course[edit | edit source]

Image Obstacle Experience Notes
Obstacle pipe 12.5 Cannot be failed. Requires 49 Agility.
Ropeswing 20 Can be failed, which will send the player down to the dungeon below.

If the ropeswing obstacle is failed, it must be re-attempted and completed to receive the course completion experience.

Stepping stone 20 Can be failed, players will not be sent down. You can only fail on the third stone. 21.6% of remaining Hitpoints will be deducted.
Log balance 20 Can be failed, which will send the player down a level. You will fail only at the beginning of the log. If you go past the starting point, you will not fail.
Rocks 498.9[d 1] Used to finish the course and get the bonus; cannot be failed.
Total 571.4 XP
  1. ↑ 498.9 experience is only rewarded if the player completed all other obstacles on the course. When this obstacle is passed without completing all other obstacles, 0 Agility experience is rewarded.

Experience rates[edit | edit source]

Due to the success rate of the obstacles, the experience rates scale with the player's Agility level. Theoretically, a maximum of 89 laps could be completed per hour (67 ticks per lap), resulting in 50,800 Agility experience per hour.

Due to obstacles being failable even at level 99 Agility, expect to achieve a maximum of around 47,500 Agility experience per hour at higher Agility levels.

At lower Agility levels expect to get around 40,000 Agility experience per hour.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • The Teleport to Target spell can be used to enter the Agility course without having the required Agility level, if the player's target is inside the gate. However, the required Agility level of 49 is still required to complete the course.

The '''Wilderness Agility Course''' is an Agility training area located in the [[Wilderness]], available to players with level 52 [[Agility]].

The Agility course rewards 571.4 Agility [[experience]] per completed lap. With an average time of 40 seconds per lap, it is possible to get upwards of 47,500 Agility experience per hour from this course. At lower Agility levels expect to get around 40,000 Agility experience per hour, depending on concentration levels.

==Introduction==
The Wilderness Agility Course requires level 52 Agility to access. However, this level is only needed to access the course through the gates; the minimum level requirement of the obstacles is level 49. Therefore it is a popular method to access this course by using a [[temporary skill boost]] to access the course starting at level 47, since the experience per hour at this course is far superior to other courses available to these players. The Agility course consists of five obstacles that players can pass in return for Agility experience. If all obstacles are passed in the correct order, some bonus experience is rewarded at the end of the lap. Some of the obstacles can be failed by the player, resulting in damage. Failed obstacles have to be tried again before going for the next obstacle, in order to become eligible for the bonus experience at the end of the lap. Players with higher Agility have a higher success rate at passing the obstacles, however even at level 99 it is still possible to fail an obstacle.

Since this Agility course is located deep in the [[Wilderness]], ranging from level 50 to 56, it is possible to come across [[Player killing|player killers]] while training there. Additionally, there are two level 25 [[skeleton]]s roaming the Agility course that will attack any player near them.

==Getting there==
There are several different methods for travelling to the Wilderness Agility Course. The best options, in order of fastest to slowest, are:
*Teleport to the [[Frozen Waste Plateau]] by casting the [[Ice Plateau Teleport]] spell. This spell is on the [[Lunar spells|Lunar spellbook]] and requires level 89 [[Magic]] and completion of {{SCP|Quest}} [[Lunar Diplomacy]] to cast. Run east from here.
*Teleport to the [[Frozen Waste Plateau]] by casting the [[Ghorrock Teleport]] spell. This spell is on the [[Ancient Magicks|Ancient spellbook]] and requires level 96 [[Magic]] and completion of {{SCP|Quest}} [[Desert Treasure]] to cast. Run north-west from here, go through the gates and then run south-east.
**Alternatively, use the [[Ghorrock teleport]] to bypass the Magic level requirement.
*Teleport to the [[Wilderness obelisk]] in level 44 [[Wilderness]]. Run north-west from here, go through the gates and then run east.
*Teleport to the [[Lava Maze]] using a [[burning amulet]]. Run north-west from here, go through the gates and then run east.
*Teleport using the [[Lever (Edgeville)|Edgeville teleport lever]] to teleport to the [[Deserted Keep]]. From here, run north and cut the web. Then run west. Bring a [[knife]] or any [[Slash weapons|slash weapon]] to cut the net.

==Strategies==
===Clothing===
*Wear [[weight-reducing clothing]] to achieve a weight of 0 kg or lower. This results in a lower run energy depletion rate.
**'''Note that this course is located in the [[Wilderness]], don't take items you are not prepared to lose.'''
*Optionally, bring armour and weaponry to combat any [[Player killing|player killers]].

===Inventory===
*Bring some [[food]] to restore lost [[Hitpoints]] from taking damage from failing Agility obstacles.
*Bring enough [[Energy#Energy-restoring items|Energy-restoring items]] for enough [[energy]] to constantly run around the course.
*Optionally, bring [[runes]] or [[tablet]]s to cast [[Bones to Peaches]], as there are [[bones]] spawns in the [[Wilderness Agility Course Dungeon]] beneath the Agility course.

==Experience rates==
Due to the success rate of the obstacles, the experience rates scale with the player's Agility level. Theoretically, a maximum of 89 laps could be completed per hour (67 [[RuneScape clock|tick]]s per lap), resulting in 50,800 Agility experience per hour.

Due to obstacles being failable even at level 99 Agility, expect to achieve a maximum of around 47,500 Agility experience per hour at higher Agility levels.

At lower Agility levels expect to get around 40,000 Agility experience per hour.

==Trivia==
*The [[Teleport to Target]] spell can be used to enter the Agility course without having the required [[Agility]] level, if the player's target is inside the gate. However, the required Agility level of 49 is still required to complete the course.
